Avoid referencing unbound methods which may cause unintentional scoping of `this`.
If your function does not access `this`, you can annotate it with `this: void`, or consider using an arrow function instead.

messages.message: This assertion is unnecessary since it does not change the type of the expression.
This assertion is unnecessary since it does not change the type of the expression.

suppressedMessages.message: Unexpected any. Specify a different type.

suggestions.desc: Use `unknown` instead, this will force you to explicitly, and safely assert the type is correct.
Use `never` instead, this is useful when instantiating generic type parameters that you don't need to know the type of.
